alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 05 at 8:19PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall from earlier today is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern West Virginia, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and small streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 815 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms that occurred earlier today. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Scary Creek, Middle Fork Mud River and Middle Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sweetland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
